title: Test
yAxis: Average ticket price in U.S. dollars
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Average ticket price in U.S. dollars, with a total of 10 data points.
Overall Average ticket price in U.S. dollars has increased over the Year.

Average ticket price in U.S. dollars is gradually increasing from 2006/07 to 2008/09, roughly constant from 2008/09 to 2009/10, slightly increasing from 2009/10 to 2010/11, roughly constant from 2010/11 to 2011/12, slightly decreasing from 2011/12 to 2013/14, and lastly roughly constant from 2013/14 to 2015/16.
The steepest increase occurs in between the Year 2006/07 and 2007/08.
Max Average ticket price in U.S. dollars about 43.65 was recorded at Year 2011/12
Min Average ticket price in U.S. dollars about 35.29 was recorded at Year 2006/07
This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Average ticket price in U.S. dollars, with a total of 10 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is moderately constant which exists from 2013/14 to 2015/16.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is slightly decreasing which exists from 2011/12 to 2013/14.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2009/10 to 2011/12.
Additionally, the next significant trend is extremely increasing which exists from 2006/07 to 2008/09.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is moderately constant which exists from 2008/09 to 2009/10.
